overview_of_class: This course is required for all senior anthropology majors and it is intended to provide students with a forum for discussion, feedback and critique of issues related to their senior capstone research project. A range of issues will be considered, including developing a research problem statement, preparing a critical literature review, clarifying research goals and methods, data analysis and writing styles and presentation of research material characteristic of the different subfields. Students will be expected to make brief presentations (in large and small group settings) about the development of their research project throughout the quarter.

descriptions.value: 1) Research Abstract, 2) Research Problem Statement (emphasizing research goals and methods), 3) Annotated Bibliography, 4) Outline of Paper, 5) Poster Presentation, 6) Final Capstone Paper, 7) Class and Group Participation
